short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Extension for Mobile Roads app which aids in automatic updating for New Zealand Regions, and includes several integrated tools.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Tool developed to add additional tools for the MobileRoad web application, allowing users of mobile roads better ease of use.

Removal of the oldest 50 markers with the click on a button allowing you to maintain your more recent markers so you don't have to clear them all.

Adds ability to use custom icons for each marker placed with detailed instructions within the Instructions tab, example TSLs by naming the marker tsl or speeds, standard markers are T1As (Work "Man" sign) or name the marker T2 for Baseball bat (Warning Sign).

Adds the ability to mouse over any State Highway in New Zealand and be given the Road Level for it based on the NZTA Waka Kotahi Interactive Map (Double check from time to time as I have to manually update the road levels using this map, Recently Updated due to new Hamilton Bypass changing State Highway 1N to State Highway 1C and the new Wellington Transmission Gully) - In the event of any out of date information please notify me and I will update this extension ASAP.

If anyone has any additional ideas which they would like me to implement I am open to suggestions.

%UPDATE 0.0.5%:
Implemented a NSLR function for all pins placed on the road, can easily be disabled by the click of a button. This was added due to user feedback to the NSLR tool option, placing its data in a more considerate location.

%UPDATE 0.0.4%:
Added ability for users to enable integration with NSLR (National Speed Limit Register), when mousing over the road wait 2 seconds and it will ping the NSLR servers a request at your current coordinates. Details around this are shown on the bottom left of your screen.
--Currently working on implementing my own API to a database that will hold all TMCs details and will display their details based on what road / area your in. This data will be community driven, please share information if you have any :)

%UPDATE 0.0.3%:
Updated newly created SH1C and  SH1N due to Hamilton Bypass.
Began update of TMC details when overlaying roads.

%UPDATE 0.0.2%:
This update brings minor changes on SH1K and SH1P (SH1P is OLD SH1N, NZTA is still looking after the road and we've been told that its still Level 2 (Was showing as Level 1).
SH1K-0012 and 0023 Were Level 2 but the NZTA Public Map now shows both as Level 1 (Now states Level 1)
